A lot of believers and unbelievers are facing a sense of man would, like you said, maybe
they're giving up on a podcast like this.
Cause it's just, it's just hard.
It just seems hard.
I don't want to think about all this stuff.
But I want to watch another 45 second cat video instead.
So now there's anything wrong with that.
But anyway, yeah, this, this conversation is hard and it's deep.
I know we know it is.
That's why we want to encourage you with it.
Stay encouraged.
Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church.
Remember, don't give up.
Trust God.
Search for answers.

<description><p>The post <a href="https://southspring.org/reconstructed-faith-worldly-theories-of-truth/">6. Reconstructed Faith &#8211; Worldly Theories of Truth</a> appeared first on <a href="https://southspring.org">South Spring Baptist Church</a>.</p>
</description>
<content:encoded><div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_46 et_section_regular" >
				
				
				
				
				
				
				<div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_46">
				<div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_46  et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
				
				
				
				
				<div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_42  et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
				
				
				
				
				<div class="et_pb_text_inner"><p><b>Worldly Theories of Truth // Show Notes </b></p>
<p>5 Worldly Theories of Truth</p>
<ul type="1">
<li><strong>(2:20)</strong> Correspondence Theory of Truth- <em>truth is the experience of what corresponds to reality. <br /></em></li>
<li><strong>(3:47)</strong> Coherentism Theory of Truth &#8211; <em>something is true if it is rational, does it make sense given the nature of reality.</em>
<ul type="1">
<li>Belief is true if it <em>coheres</em> to the overarching systems of belief.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>(16:21)</strong> Pragmatism Theory of Truth &#8211; <em>something that works, if it works then it is true.</em>
<ul type="1">
<li>True beliefs are accepted at the end of an inquiry.</li>
<li>Falls closely with empirical evidence
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>(23:15)</strong> Deflationary Theory of Truth &#8211; the word truth doesn’t mean anything. Truth is a non-sensical concept.
<ol type="a">
<li>The problem with deflationary theory is, if the word truth doesn&#8217;t matter, then why do we care so much about it? &#8211;<i> Raymond Tallis<br /></i></li>
</ol>
</li>
<li><strong>(28:08)</strong> Nihilism Theory of Truth &#8211; <em>nothing is true.</em>
<ul type="1">
<li>We only know things through our brains.</li>
<li>Truth is entirely an invention of the human brain</li>
<li><em>Relativism</em> is part of that &#8211; truth is out there, but we can’t ever really know what it is because everyone is different and interprets things different.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Other notable episode timestamps: </strong></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>(9:22)</strong> Discussion of Belief vs. Truth </li>
<li><strong>(18:19)</strong> Danger of Rebuilding Faith with a Pragmatic Theory </li>
<li><strong>(19:03)</strong> Discussion of Community Capital</li>
<li><strong>(37:53)</strong> Why are these Theories relevant to us? </li>
</ul></div>
			</div>
			</div>
				
				
				
				
			</div>
				
				
			</div>
<p>The post <a href="https://southspring.org/reconstructed-faith-worldly-theories-of-truth/">6. Reconstructed Faith &#8211; Worldly Theories of Truth</a> appeared first on <a href="https://southspring.org">South Spring Baptist Church</a>.</p>
</content:encoded>

5 Worldly Theories of Truth<br />
<br />
* (2:20) Correspondence Theory of Truth- truth is the experience of what corresponds to reality. <br />
* (3:47) Coherentism Theory of Truth - something is true if it is rational, does it make sense given the nature of reality.<br />
<br />
* Belief is true if it coheres to the overarching systems of belief.<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
* (16:21) Pragmatism Theory of Truth - something that works, if it works then it is true.<br />
<br />
* True beliefs are accepted at the end of an inquiry.<br />

<br />
<br />
<br />
* (23:15) Deflationary Theory of Truth - the word truth doesn’t mean anything. Truth is a non-sensical concept.<br />
<br />
* The problem with deflationary theory is, if the word truth doesn't matter, then why do we care so much about it? - Raymond Tallis<br />
<br />
<br />
* (28:08) Nihilism Theory of Truth - nothing is true.<br />
<br />
* We only know things through our brains.<br />
* Truth is entirely an invention of the human brain<br />
* Relativism is part of that - truth is out there, but we can’t ever really know what it is because everyone is different and interprets things different.<br />
<br />
